{% endraw %}

The Object Class

The object class is a simple object that is under pins the functionality of the object handler class below. Every object class requires an object id and has a get_properties() method that retrieves a dictionary of the objects attributes that are a python property

{% raw %}

class Base_Object[source]

Base_Object(object_id=None)

A base object. The only requirement of all objects is that they have an object_id which can be used as a DataFrame index and for tracking in the Handler class.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Tests

{% raw %} 
new_obj = Base_Object(object_id=123)
assert type(new_obj.object_id) == str
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
second_obj = Base_Object(object_id=234)
object_id = second_obj.get_properties().get('object_id')
assert second_obj.object_id == object_id
{% endraw %}

The Handler Class

base handler class that can move between the object space and a pandas df

each object class has an object_id and a get_properties method that will convert it's properties to a dictionary. This method is the basis for creating the pandas dataframe

{% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
handler = Base_Handler(Base_Object,obj_list=[new_obj, second_obj])
handler.object_properties

['object_id']
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class Base_Handler[source]

Base_Handler(obj_class=Base_Object, obj_list=None, obj_df=None, property_mappings={})

{% endraw %}
